page.title: 06The Express Dairy -Appleby
page.content: The Express Dairy collects 385,000 litres of milk by tanker from 400 surrounding farms every day.The milk is pumped from road tanks into three storage tanks which store 100,000 gallons of milk.It goes from these tanks into the cheese factory at a rate of 10,000 gallons per hour. It is pasteurized and pumped into vats.Most of the milk is made into Eden vale chedder cheese plus whey butter and demineralised whey powder.40,000 litres of milk are taken for processing and is put into cartons for milkmen. Milk from the farms arrives at the creamery in the tankers and is then sampled. Some of the milk is made into 5kg or 20kg blocks of cheese.More than 170 people work at the Express Dairy. Our dads work there. Gayle Ingham Gary Coward
